Detailed Description

Definition at line 42 of file system.php.

Member Function Documentation

System::System (  ) 

rc.local module search strings and descriptions

rc.local file should have lines like the following:

 if [ -x /usr/local/libexec/symon ]; then
 	echo -n ' symon';
 	/usr/local/libexec/symon
 fi

Indeces of this array are used to comment or uncomment the lines like the 3rd one above.

rc.conf.local module search strings and descriptions

Todo:
Is there any pattern or size for options, 6th param?

00423         exec($cmd, $output, $retval);
00424         if ($retval === 0) {
00425             if (count($output) > 0) {

System::SetIf ( $  if,
$  type,
$  ip,
$  mask,
$  bc,
$  opt 
)

Sets system interface configuration.

Parameters:
[in] $if Interface name.
[in] $type inet or dhcp.
[in] $ip IP.
[in] $mask Netmask.
[in] $bc Broadcast address.
[in] $opt Options.

Warning:
Need a new line at the end of a line in hostname.if (otherwise /etc/netstart fails), file_put_contents() removes the last new line

Definition at line 522 of file system.php.

References $Re_Ip, and ViewError().

Referenced by System().

00523     {
00524         global $Re_Ip;
00525         
00526         // Trim for whitespace caused by empty strings
00527         $ifconf= trim("$type $ip $mask $bc $opt");
00528         // ComixWall supports only these configuration
00529         if (preg_match("/^inet\s*$Re_Ip\s*$Re_Ip\s*($Re_Ip|).*$/", $ifconf)
00530             || preg_match('/^dhcp\s*NONE\s*NONE\s*NONE.*$/', $ifconf)
00531             || preg_match('/^dhcp$/', $ifconf)) {
00533             return file_put_contents($this->confDir.'hostname.'.$if, $ifconf.PHP_EOL);
00534         }
00535         else {
00536             ViewError(_('Unsupported interface configuration').": $ifconf");
00537         }

System::DaemonizeFunc ( $  func,
$  param = '' 
)

Daemonizes to run the given function.

Definition at line 999 of file system.php.

01000     {
01001         $pid= pcntl_fork();
01002         if ($pid == -1) {
01003             cwc_syslog(LOG_ERR, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'Cannot fork');
01004         }
01005         else if ($pid) {
01006              // Parent should exit
01007             return TRUE;
01008         }
01009         else {
01010             // Make the child process a session leader
01011             $sid= posix_setsid();
01012             if ($sid < 0) {
01013                 cwc_syslog(LOG_ERR, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'Cannot make the child a session leader');
01014                 // Exit if cannot daemonize completely
01015                 return FALSE;
01016             }
01017             // The child is daemonized now, hence survives even if its process group is killed.
01018             // This is necessary when rotating httpd logs.
01019 
01020             $argv= array();
01021             if ($param !== '') {
01022                 $argv= array($param);
01023             }
01024             return call_user_func_array(array($this, $func), $argv);
01025         }
01026     }
